alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 20 at 3:36PM EDT until October 20 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern York County in Upstate South Carolina... Central Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 336 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Shelby to near Gaffney to 11 miles north of Spartanburg, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Sharon, Hickory Grove, Smyrna, Cherokee Falls, Draytonville, Saratt, Kings Creek, Thicketty, Blacksburg, and Kings Mountain State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
